s1.ptxt: Remove countershaft rear bearing (1) using bearing puller, metal stick (2) and hydraulic press.
Hold hatched area (5) of countershaft assembly (1) with “V” blocks (4) on vise (2) or the like to stop rotation of shaft, undo caulking and countershaft front bearing nut (3).

attention2.ptxt: Do not hold spline, gear teeth or abrasived surface of shaft with “V” blocks on vise or the like, otherwise shaft may be damaged.

s1.ptxt: Apply bearing puller to 2nd gear (1), and drive out countershaft front bearing (2), countershaft reverse gear (3), 1st gear (4), countershaft gear needle bearings, countershaft low needle bearing bush, low speed synchronizer assembly (5) and 2nd gear all at once from countershaft using metal stick (6) and hydraulic press.

attention2.ptxt: To avoid gear teeth from being damaged, support 2nd gear at flat side of bearing puller.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Countershaft and Reverse Idle Gear Inspection

s1.ptxt: Clean all components thoroughly, inspect them for any abnormality and replace with new ones as necessary.
To ensure lubrication, air blow oil holes (1) and make sure that they are free from any obstruction.
Drive in countershaft rear bearing (1) using special tool and hammer.
Apply oil to countershaft gear needle bearing (6), and then install needle bearing, 2nd gear (5) and low speed synchronizer ring (7).
Assemble synchronizer sleeve (4) and hub (3) as follows.

s2.ptxt: Fit low speed synchronizer sleeve to hub in specified direction as shown in figure.
Set springs (1) at specified position as shown in figure.

s1.ptxt: Drive in low speed synchronizer assembly (1) using special tool and hammer.

item.ptxt: While press-fitting sleeve & hub, make sure that synchronizer ring key slots (2) are aligned with keys in sleeve & hub assembly.
Check free rotation of 2nd gear after press-fitting sleeve & hub assembly.

s1.ptxt: Check 2nd gear (1) thrust clearance by using thickness gauge. If clearance is out of specification, repress-fit or replace defective part.
Apply oil to countershaft gear needle bearing, and then countershaft low needle bush, needle bearing and 1st gear (1) to countershaft.
Press-fit countershaft reverse gear (2) using special tool and hammer.
Press-fit countershaft front bearing (1) using special tool and hammer.
Check low gear (1) thrust clearance by using thickness gauge. If clearance is out of specification, repress-fit or replace defective part.
Tighten countershaft front bearing nut to specified torque while locking counter shaft in the same manner as step 2) of “Disassembly” under Countershaft Disassembly and Assembly .

attention2.ptxt: Do not hold spline, gear teeth or abrasived surface of shaft with vise through “V” blocks or the like, otherwise shaft may be damaged.

s1.ptxt: Caulk countershaft front bearing nut using caulking tool and hammer.
